Package space.sunqian.fs.io

Interface CharReader

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable
public interface CharReader extends Closeable
This interface represents the char data reader to read char data as CharSegment from the data source, which may be a char sequence or a stream.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default @Nonnull Reader
    asReader()
    Returns a Reader represents this reader.

    Reads a specified length of data from this reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

    Reads available data into the specified appender, until no data is immediately available, returns the actual number of chars read to.

    Resets this reader to the last marked position by mark().

  • Method Details

    • from

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull CharReader from(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src)
      Wraps the given reader as a new CharReader.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: based on the reader;
      • close: closes the reader;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      src - the given reader
      Returns:
      the given reader as a new CharReader

    • from

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull CharReader from(@Nonnull @Nonnull Reader src, int bufferSize) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Wraps the given reader as a new CharReader with the given buffer size.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: based on the reader;
      • close: closes the reader;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      src - the given reader
      bufferSize - the given buffer size, must > 0
      Returns:
      the given reader as a new CharReader
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given buffer size <= 0

    • from

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull CharReader from(char @Nonnull [] src)
      Wraps the given array as a new CharReader.

      The content of the segment returned from the read(int) is shared with the array. Any changes to the segment's content will be reflected in the array, and vice versa.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: supported;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      src - the given array
      Returns:
      the given array as a new CharReader

    • from

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull CharReader from(char @Nonnull [] src, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Wraps a specified length of data from the given array, starting at the specified offset, as a new CharReader.

      The content of the segment returned from the read(int) is shared with the array. Any changes to the segment's content will be reflected in the array, and vice versa.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: supported;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      src - the given array
      off - the specified offset
      len - the specified length
      Returns:
      the given array as a new CharReader
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the bounds arguments are out of bounds

    • from

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull CharReader from(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence src)
      Wraps the given char sequence as a new CharReader.

      The content of the segment returned from the read(int) is shared with the array. Any changes in the array will be reflected to the segment's content, but not vice versa.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: supported;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      src - the char sequence
      Returns:
      the char sequence as a new CharReader

    • from

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull CharReader from(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence src, int start, int end) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Wraps the given char sequence, starting at the specified start index inclusive and ending at the specified end index exclusive, as a new CharReader.

      The content of the segment returned from the read(int) is shared with the array. Any changes in the array will be reflected to the segment's content, but not vice versa.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: supported;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      src - the given char sequence
      start - the specified start index inclusive
      end - the specified end index exclusive
      Returns:
      the given char sequence as a new CharReader
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the bounds arguments are out of bounds

    • from

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull CharReader from(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer src)
      Wraps the given buffer as a new CharReader.

      The content of the segment returned from the read(int) is shared with the array. Any changes to the segment's content will be reflected in the array (if it is not readonly), and vice versa.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: supported;
      • close: invoking has no effect;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      src - the given buffer
      Returns:
      the given buffer as a new CharReader

    • ready

      int ready() throws IORuntimeException
      Returns the chars number this reader is ready to be read, may be 0.

      Note some data sources are unpredictable, so even if this method returns 0, it does not necessarily mean that there is no data can be read out immediately

      Returns:
      the chars number this reader is ready to be read, may be 0
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      @Nonnull @Nonnull CharSegment read(int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads and returns the next specified length of data segment. This method reads continuously until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of this reader. It never returns null, but can return an empty segment.

      If the specified length is 0, returns an empty segment immediately without reading.

      The content of the returned segment may be shared with the data source, depends on the implementation, such as the instances obtained from the from(char[]), from(char[], int, int), from(CharSequence), from(CharSequence, int, int) and from(CharBuffer).

      Note this method may allocate the specified length of space, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      len - the specified length to read, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the next data segment
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified length < 0
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      @Nullable @Nullable CharBuffer read() throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data from this reader, and returns an array contains the data. This method reads continuously until reaches the end of this reader. It may return null if the reader has already reached the end of the source and no data read out.

      The content of the returned segment may be shared with the data source, depends on the implementation, such as the instances obtained from the from(char[]), from(char[], int, int), from(CharSequence), from(CharSequence, int, int) and from(CharBuffer).

      Returns:
      the all data as buffer
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • skip

      long skip(long len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Skips the next specified length of data segment. This method skips continuously until the skipped number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of this reader.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 immediately without skipping.

      Parameters:
      len - the specified length to skip, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual skipped length
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified length < 0
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      long readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads all data into the specified appender, until reaches the end of this reader, returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      This method never invokes the OutputStream.flush() to force the backing buffer.

      Parameters:
      dst - the specified appender
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      long readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst, long len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data into the specified appender, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of this reader, returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      This method never invokes the OutputStream.flush() to force the backing buffer.

      Parameters:
      dst - the specified appender
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      int readTo(char @Nonnull [] dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from this reader into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or reaches the end of this reader, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the array's length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      dst - the destination array
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      int readTo(char @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from this reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of this reader, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads data from this reader into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the reader or buffer, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • readTo

      int readTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from this reader into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the reader or buffer, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      @Nonnull @Nonnull CharSegment available(int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads and returns the next specified length of data segment. This method reads continuously until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available. It never returns null, but can return an empty segment.

      If the specified length is 0, returns an empty segment immediately without reading.

      The content of the returned segment may be shared with the data source, depends on the implementation, such as the instances obtained from the from(char[]), from(char[], int, int), from(CharSequence), from(CharSequence, int, int) and from(CharBuffer).

      Note this method may allocate the specified length of space, and the excessive length may cause out of memory.

      Parameters:
      len - the specified length to read, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the next data segment
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified length < 0
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • available

      @Nonnull @Nonnull CharSegment available() throws IORuntimeException
      Reads and returns the next available data segment. This method reads continuously until no data is immediately available. It never returns null, but can return an empty segment.

      The content of the returned segment may be shared with the data source, depends on the implementation, such as the instances obtained from the from(char[]), from(char[], int, int) and from(CharBuffer).

      Returns:
      the next available data segment
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      long availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data into the specified appender, until no data is immediately available, returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      This method never invokes the OutputStream.flush() to force the backing buffer.

      Parameters:
      dst - the specified appender
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      long availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst, long len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data into the specified appender, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      This method never invokes the OutputStream.flush() to force the backing buffer.

      Parameters:
      dst - the specified appender
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      int availableTo(char @Nonnull [] dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from this reader into the destination array, until the read number reaches the array's length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the array's length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      dst - the destination array
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      int availableTo(char @Nonnull [] dst, int off, int len) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from this reader into the destination array, starting at the specified offset, until the read number reaches the specified length or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length is 0, returns 0 without reading. If reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      Parameters:
      dst - the destination array
      off - the specified offset of the array
      len - the specified length to read
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the arguments are out of bounds
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst) throws IORuntimeException
      Reads available data from this reader into the destination buffer, until reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      dst - the destination buffer
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • availableTo

      int availableTo(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer dst, int len) throws IllegalArgumentException, IORuntimeException
      Reads a specified length of data from this reader into the destination buffer, until the read number reaches the specified length or reaches the end of the buffer or no data is immediately available, and returns the actual number of chars read to.

      If the specified length or destination buffer's remaining is 0, returns 0 without reading; if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read, returns -1.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Parameters:
      dst - the specified buffer
      len - the specified length, must >= 0
      Returns:
      the actual number of chars read to, possibly 0, or -1 if reaches the end of this reader and no data is read
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified read length is illegal
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • markSupported

      boolean markSupported()
      Returns whether this reader supports the mark() and reset() methods.
      Returns:
      whether this reader supports the mark() and reset() methods

    • mark

      void mark() throws IORuntimeException
      Marks the current position in this reader. This method can be used to mark a position for later reset().
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • reset

      void reset() throws IORuntimeException
      Resets this reader to the last marked position by mark(). This method can be used to re-read the data from last marked position.
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • close

      void close() throws IORuntimeException
      Closes this reader and the data source if the data source is closable. If this reader is already closed, this method has no effect.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Throws:
      IORuntimeException - if an I/O error occurs

    • limit

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull CharReader limit(long limit) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Wraps this reader as a new CharReader of which readable number is limited to the specified limit. The shareability of the content of the returned segment inherits this reader.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: based on this reader;
      • close: closes this reader;
      • thread safety: no;
      Parameters:
      limit - the specified limit, must >= 0
      Returns:
      this reader as a new CharReader of which readable number is limited to the specified limit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the limit argument is negative

    • asReader

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull Reader asReader()
      Returns a Reader represents this reader. Its content and status are shared with this reader.

      The result's support is as follows:

      • mark/reset: based on this reader;
      • close: closes this reader;
      • thread safety: no;
      Returns:
      a Reader represents this reader. Its content and status are shared with this reader
